question.title: Learn to Comment - Java
question.content:
Comments are very useful in any language to tell users what is the task of any function or operation. The comments are neglected by the compiler, so whatever you write in the comments won't have any effect on the working of a code.
In Java, comments can be written as mentioned below:
/*This is a comment*/
//This is also a comment
Comment out the line that prints the value of b.

Examples: 

Input: a = 5, b = 6, c = 15
Output:
5
15
Input:a = 5, b = 8, c = 15
Output:
5
15

rephrased.body: In Java, comments are used to explain the purpose of code and are ignored by the compiler. Your task is to comment out the line that prints the value of variable `b` in the given code.

testcases.explanation: The line printing the value of 'b' (which is 6) should be commented out, resulting in only 'a' (5) and 'c' (15) being printed.
Similar to the first test case, commenting out the line printing 'b' (which is 8) will result in only 'a' (5) and 'c' (15) being printed.

hints: Do not delete the line which prints "b" from the code.
